website_summaries.verdict: Allows for quick and easy power lifting but not for anything too heavy or too intense.
pros: Affordable price for a cage that allows for the simple stuff like pull-ups, lightweight squats, and bench work
Looks good and fits nicely in small home gyms
cons: Some parts feel relatively cheap compared to other cages on the market

customer_reviews.title: They fixed the packaging problem
customer_reviews.text: I usually don’t write reviews but decided to do one in case anyone was on the fence because of the bad reviews about packaging and condition of the product when it arrived. It seems CAP heard the criticism and fixed it. The rack came in one box with all the pieces carefully wrapped. The hardware was clearly marked and vacuum packed to prevent spillage. No items were bent or scratched and there was no rust. All of which were common complaints. They also added better instructions that were easy to follow, took me an hour to put together. The rack is very sturdy and a great buy for the price! Looking forward to my workouts!
customer_reviews.author: Ray Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Huge thick and a lot beefier than you imagine. Package arrived flawless. Assembled in 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Tom from South Florida

customer_reviews.title: Rusted parts...
customer_reviews.text: Read this first... there were plenty of negative ratings and comments on this rack but there were also a few with good ratings... don't think that will be you! The quality of this product is awful and I recommend you order from a sports store vs a taking a chance on Amazon. Upon opening for setup the box smelled moldy and the parts inside were rusting... picture is worth 1000 words see the pile of rust that came out of the support bracing...
customer_reviews.author: Jr

customer_reviews.title: Don't even bother.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a great rack for the price and regardless of all the prior comments about them not having their packaging figured out I decided to order anyways. Too bad it didn't even make it here and I waited through 3 weeks of shipping for UPS to return the package because it was too damaged to even make it here. Thank you CAP for wasting 3 weeks with nothing to show for it.
customer_reviews.author: reece goodman

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Box is trash. Luckily everything was still there except for 1 piece that I didn’t care for it. Setup with easy took me less than 30 minutes but it was all scratched up for being “new”. Some of the attachments were a little loose but I can just pound it in. I set it up in the garage but I can easily say that you definitely need to bolt it down if you are planning to do heavy lifting. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Vichai L.

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t purchase again
customer_reviews.text: The rack works well for what it’s designed to do. Quality of the rubber is comically bad, but easily fixed. The big problem is the packaging and the handling of the item. Two pieces of metal were bent so far out of shape, I had to pry them straight with a crowbar and a vice. The box was delivered with holes and had some sandy substance all over the inside. Overall, not a bad rack but the quality assurance is nearly nonexistent from what I can tell.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: First was skeptical about the rack due to such great price. I received it yes package was damaged but I did not mind I am going to scratch it up and bang it up anyways. I am a heavy lifter baought to switch over to free weights and home quarantine gym workouts. Well rack is great can handle my heavy squats 400 plus work out weight. I know if I slam into it hard I am sure it will bend but it can support the weight and make sure to anchor with minimum 4 red head anchors to the ground. Great for bench as well and all banded excercises. Recomend to any small home personal gym.
customer_reviews.author: Eliseo Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, perfect for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed! Looks heavy duty, and for the $200ish is a perfect choice for a home gym. Assembly process went smooth. Some home didn't aligned perfectly but wasn't a big deal. No modifications needed as some of the items sometimes need. Took almost 3 weeks to receive it, totally worth it. Definitely not perfect, and some manufacture issues need to be addressed, 8 think I was lucky to receive a unit with "decent" defects, would recommend of you're just looking for something cheap. If you want something for longer time and money is not a problem you should invest in a better rack. This works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Tech

customer_reviews.title: Met or exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: I read dozens of reviews before purchasing, including different star values (1 thru 5). I was a little concerned but really wanted this rack. I hoped that the negative feedback issues that I read about had been addressed. They obviously have! My rack was shipped well, packaged well, and there were NO parts missing. It looks great and functions as expected. We've been using it now for several weeks and couldn't be happier! Great value!
customer_reviews.author: SpeakingOf Reality

customer_reviews.title: Tolerancing issue, assembly issue. Sturdy despite it all.
customer_reviews.text: (What is "stretch"? Its usefulness in stretching?) Pretty dang good. Some tolerancing issues, some design issues. The tapped hole in one post doesn't line up with the through-hole drilled into the post that stacks on top of it. Also, the included wrench tool doesn't have room to twist the nuts holding the vertical posts. Other than that (the tolerancing of the holes is my biggest complaint), this is a
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality assurance before shipping.
customer_reviews.text: They definitely need so QA in production. I got all the way to assembling the last part and when i put the sleeve over the other part i found that the holes do not align with screw holes and i cannot bolt it together on one side. It seems the measurements are off and i cannot make it stable on the right side after all that assembling. Very disappointed. Not sure what to do now.
customer_reviews.author: hdpunk

customer_reviews.title: Stabilizer screw holes not aligned properly.
customer_reviews.text: The packaging wasn’t awful. But there is a manufacturing deficiency which has led to the two screw holes on the right stabilizer not aligning with the holes on the horizontal beam. I can choose to screw in one or the other but not both. Very frustrating as I feel this is a significant safety risk. I have tried to contact. Customer service multiple times and gotten no response.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Rosati

customer_reviews.title: If you squat ass to grass, keep looking. Not for serious bodybuilding.
customer_reviews.text: Good enough but not great. Depending on how tall you are if you squat ass to grass low or bench to touch your chest, the weights on your barbell will clash with the ones on the plate holder. Plate holders only hold a pair of 45s and 35s. So if you've got a full set you want to store on here forget it. Safety catches are also extremely short. Rack shakes when doing pull ups.
customer_reviews.author: ErrorProxy

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty? No. Effective? Yes.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty? No. This is made out of 16 Ga Steel. However it did get the job done for me for a few years
customer_reviews.author: A.S.

customer_reviews.title: Bolts don’t fit!
customer_reviews.text: This product is pretty heavy duty if it’s manufactured correctly! 4 of the 6 bolts that hold the uprights together were predrilled too big for the bolts provided! On top of that I went to the hardware store and bought 3 different bolts to try and none of those fit either! Also 1 of the bar catches had wild welding that needed to be grinded off in order to fit the hole! Idk where these are manufactured but they need better quality control for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin s Takatsuka

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was speedy, assembly was not bad, even though a ratchet helps a lot. If you have a shorter barbell, (around 60" or so) you will have problems. On a final note, whoever delivered took a picture of my house...and it appears on my login. Not too keen about that.
customer_reviews.author: E.Gray

customer_reviews.title: Great piece. Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. For those saying the holes didn’t line up, chances are they tightened the bolts right away. Loosely secure the bolts and nuts where they go and then gradually tighten all of them one after the other. A piece came damaged, but I took some pictures and emailed customer service. And in about a week I got a replacement piece. The rack is sturdy. Holds weight well. And using the pull-up bar works fine too. Easiest customer service help. Just be nice and explain the problem, and supply them with the info they need. And it couldn’t be any simpler. Very happy with mynpurchase
customer_reviews.author: kasey

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy to say that the cage was delivered ahead of ...
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase this product based on previous reviews concerning the packaging and items being left out. I'm happy to say that the cage was delivered ahead of schedule and the packaging was intact! The smaller package containing the nuts, bolts, and screws was slightly torn, but all of the parts were there. I was able to put the cage together in a little over an hour. I immediately did 10 pull-ups and it was very sturdy and stood up to my 215lb. frame. I am very pleased with this product!
customer_reviews.author: James A. Harvey, Jr

customer_reviews.title: Handling of delivery
customer_reviews.text: The handling of the delivery was atrocious. The box looked like it had fell of the back of the delivery truck and the parts inside are scratched, gouged and support flanges bent. I can't speak to the ease of assembly or the durability of the product because I'm apprehensive about a) if it can be assembled as is, and b) if it can be assembled, has the structural integrity been compromised due to the mishandling and bent flanges.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: Probably worth two stars, but I knew I was getting what I paid for. This will get the job done for pull-ups, moderately heavy squats, and I suppose some bench work if you have a standalone bench to use. It's pretty cheaply built and mine has a slight lean to it. It doesn't impact my lifts, but I'd be very cautious when approaching the max capacity for this thing. I also don't feel comfortable squatting anything over 300 if I don't have weights on the side plate-holders. There are tabs to bolt this to the floor, which could eliminate some concerns, but that's not an option in my garage. I'd recommend something that was sturdier to avoid potential side-racking/leaning.
customer_reviews.author: N.A.R.

customer_reviews.title: Good but please buy different barbell racks
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice power rack and I don’t really have any complaints if it wasn’t for the annoying barbell rack (not the long safety bars that extend outwards). For some reason, the pieces where you put the barbell on the power rack, are exact replicas of each other rather than mirrors of one another. This can make tbis powerrack very dangerous quickly as I many times by moving the barbell from left to right, ending up removing it off the barbell racks, causing the barbell to fall down onto the bench.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Good price but quality control issues
customer_reviews.text: The included J-cup cradles on the "FM-8000F Deluxe Power Rack" would bend away from the rack quite easily.Totally usable, but to be safe I'd recommend replacing the J-Cups and safety arms right away via a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT POWER RACK!!
customer_reviews.text: This is EXACTLY what I was looking for as a home replacement to the gym. I will continue to go to my local gym. However this is more than enough to get the job done. Very sturdy and the box came in great condition. The hardware in perfect condition. I absolutely love everything about it. There are two barbell holders that I didn’t even notice when purchasing it. And there are resistance band holders on each leg that I’ve already put to great use. If this ever becomes available again, do yourself a favor and BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Awaiting issue resolution.
customer_reviews.text: Missing the bar holder parts. Package was badly damaged. Many parts(J-hooks specifically) were bent. The J-hooks and safety bars also do not have the rubber padding on them that would snug-up the fit against the square column tubes. There's a lot of play between the safety bars/j-hooks and the square tubing. Still working with customer service on getting replacements. Will update if issues resolved. Overall opinion so far, probably wouldn't recommend unless issues resolved. If issues resolved, would and will recommend for novice lifters like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Tiger

customer_reviews.title: The worst thing I've ever spent $200 on
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage,don't waste your time and money. Bad welds,bad paint,everything is crooked,not stable,rust. If I could give it negative stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: Kim and Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Box and product came damaged from shipping
customer_reviews.text: All of the metal parts were bent or scraped and paint was chipping off the base. The box was a wreck so I had no way to return this or I would have. I assembled it and bent the pieces so it came together. I'll have to buy touch up paint to prevent rust. Other than that, it's what you'd expect from a $200 rack. Fairly flimsy but serviceable. In hindsight, I'd probably save some $$ and buy another Rogue. THeir stuff is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The construction was very sturdy and use of the many bolts in the process. I really like this item but the box it was shipped in was ripped and torn open. You should put fragile on the box so UPS takes care of it. I'm surprised everything was in there, there were lots of scratches on the blue end pieces but It still looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Solino

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Do not order this! Save yourself the time and expense. This was delivered without instructions and missing a part. The Allen wrench that came with it was not strong enough to withstand tightening the screws and became stripped while assembling. Also, the ridges inside the pull up bar were manufactured at an angle, so the screw cannot fully screw in to properly and safely secure the pull up bar to the rack. This was a huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Huggins

customer_reviews.title: Starting a home gym? Gotta have this!
customer_reviews.text: If you know the price range of racks then you would understand you get what you pay for. But this rack has changed that quite a bit for me, not only is it a steal for the price but the quality is ridiculously good. I have a 300lb Olympic weight set that fits perfectly with no hassles and the rack holds on perfectly without bolting it to the floor. If you are just starting to build a home gym this product is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Cisco N Jazzy Canez

customer_reviews.title: Decent rack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2015-2016 and have used it on and off. Its very simple and fit in my room which is pretty small but with the barbell it did take up a lot of space. the rack wobbles a lot when doing pull ups but nothing to crazy. I have left a loaded barbell on the rack for up to a month and nothing seems to have been damaged. overall it meet my squatting needs and I would definitely recommend to any wanting to get into better shape. Probably the best investment i have made.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Came Damaged and Unstable
customer_reviews.text: The box came extremely damaged. The assembly was pretty straightforward; however, we were missing one peg that holds the weight, several pieces were bent out of shape, and many of the holes had residue that we had to clean off before the screws would fit. There was damage to the paint in several places and the plastic linings were falling off from the box. Additionally the rack isn’t that sturdy itself. It wobbles when reracking or doing pull ups (I only weigh 180).
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Huynh

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Well like many other reviewers experienced, the box looked like it had traveled through a war zone and you could see where the carrier wrapped the box up in miles of tape to keep it together, they logged the shipment as an open box when they dropped it off. Fortunately nothing fell out. The rack went together easilY. It will be sturdy enough for my garage gym and while not up to the standards and ruggedness of a Rouge rack, at less than half the price I feel it was a bargain and a solid piece of equipment, I have no reservations, pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, Sturdy enough
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly easy to assemble! I did it myself in less than an hour with just a wrench. It wobbled a bit when I did pullups (I'm 135lbs), but for the price and size, I think it's sturdy enough. The movable pieces that hold and catch the bar (2 of each) were bent out of shape, but I was able to correct with a little muscle.
customer_reviews.author: Sarahbeth T. S.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in packaging.
customer_reviews.text: This product came pretty beat up! Had tons of scratches and didn’t come with all the hardware to put it together. I had to go and buy the bolts which were like 5$ a piece! Box was pretty messed up when I got it so I imagine the bolts ended up falling out. A little disappointed for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Good for a garage gym. Don’t expect attention to details in how it was built
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a decent rack for a garage gym. The bad(s); the j-hook ends are very long, you have to set them low to unrack the barbell. It is a bit shaky, but I have not bolted it to the ground yet, will see when I do. The plate poles do not fit my rogue bumper plates. This one bugs me a lot because I was looking forward to free up some precious space in my garage gym. I contacted CAP about the poles about 2 weeks ago; no response.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo Litovsky

customer_reviews.title: The rack itself is good!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy when you put weights on the plate holder. Wobbles a little otherwise. Some of the cut outs for the holes weren’t big enough. Had to file the hole down a bit for safety arm. Once you work through the kinks, you can’t beat the value. Packaging came destroyed with holes. The rack was scratched and battered. They need better packaging for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack for the price.  Stable.
customer_reviews.text: I think they must have a quality control issue at the factory that is still in need of improvement, as the unit had many cosmetic defects that should have been caught. Scratches, dents, misprint of post numbers. Post position 10 is through the joint between upper and lower posts and will not align, so that the position cannot be used as a weight station. This is a bummer, since it would be the perfect location for my bench. I gave this rack 4 stars. It seems very stable, and is more than adequate. It looks great at 10 feet. Any closer and you start to see the cosmetic issues I mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: jeff swaim

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: Great value Easy install Very solid Looked at many from all makers This was by far the best bang for the buck Took 30 min to put together one piece I had to bang with a hammer to bend a fraction so it would slide together, 3 hammer hits and that was it. This is the cage you want.
customer_reviews.author: USMC REESE

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack To Have!
customer_reviews.text: The box was really banged up when it was delivered buy thankfully all the pieces were there and easy to put together! This was a great purchase for this Spring and looks awesome in our home gym!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen G

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: This is very cheaply made and cannot withstand weight above 225lbs with out stress on the rack. I put this together and took back apart and purchased ROUGE monster rack.
customer_reviews.author: scott hoff

customer_reviews.title: Packaging is laughably horrendous, but works fine once you get all the parts.
customer_reviews.text: Took 2 orders (with both boxes severely damaged) in order to get all the parts to assemble one rack. It was actually comical that Amazon demanded I ship the partial box of parts back in order to get a refund. The rack will work fine for light use in a home garage. I'm no powerlifter, so the stability is fine. Love the fact that it has an integrated pull up bar. In all, it works fine for light duty, assuming it actually gets to you in one piece.
customer_reviews.author: LMH

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The room where I placed this is not that tall and I had to take the top caps off so it fits. Been using it for a few months and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: rAf

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and has added weight storage advantage
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Very sturdy which exceeded expectations. I was thinking of going with the lesser expensive version of this product, but it did not have the same thickness in metal, or braces that make this sturdy, and it did not have storage for weights like this one. This is def. worth the extra money for storage and build in safety features. Nice quality product.
customer_reviews.author: AvidRavensFan

customer_reviews.title: The box was beat to crap. Some of the pieces had rust on them
customer_reviews.text: It definitely meets the needs that we had. I own a Physical Therapy clinic, and I wanted something to hold our weights and possibly a TRX. I'm going to have to figure out how to secure it (not sure we can bolt it into the floor), but otherwise just what I needed for the price. I agree with the shipping though. The box was beat to crap. Some of the pieces had rust on them, and were very dirty. We cleaned as we went. I put it together myself in about 1.5 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Good for the $. Kinda Wobbly.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good starting unit to buy. I do like it. But it is not a solid or sturdy as I would like. The metal is not as thick I was expecting and the two main upright post are two pieces. It's a little wobbly but holds over 315 so far.
customer_reviews.author: AR-Gun Lover

customer_reviews.title: Arrived beat to hell but i love it.
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived like it was thrown out the back of a truck and roll down a hill but luckily all of parts were in it and surprisingly undamaged it works great i really wouldn't use the pull up bar for muscle ups or anything crazy like that but it is my favorite piece of equipment in my home gym very versatile.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miera

customer_reviews.title: Missing & Damaged equipment.
customer_reviews.text: Right now it is a 1 out of 5 because I just had this delivered and it was delivered with a damaged piece and a missing piece. Overall the rack seems to be good for the price but I’m disappointed with the missing piece (the plate holder) which is one of the reasons I spent extra money on this rack instead of the cheaper model. The safety catch came damaged as well.
customer_reviews.author: David Hopper

customer_reviews.title: Just as everyone else described
customer_reviews.text: Box showed up absolutely trashed, with pieces of the painted rack sticking out and damaged. I refused the shipment. For the money it is serviceable but just know you get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good quality rack for home gym
customer_reviews.text: Product was just as I expected it, good quality and actually shipped far faster than I thought given everything going on. The set up is really easy, if you have your own tools. It would probably have been a pain given the wrench that came with the kit but I didn’t use it so I can’t say. The only downside is it has a little wiggle, but I’ve been doing pull-ups on it and with weights on the bottom I’m not worried it’s going to fall over. Overall very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Tj Stone

customer_reviews.title: the weight rack on the sides are mostly useless for anything as the metal there is too thin ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't blame the manufacturer for it, but the box came torn open in a few spots, the bolt bag was torn and I was missing a few nuts, and one of the metal "stabilization fins" was bent a bit that I needed to correct with a hammer. the weight rack on the sides are mostly useless for anything as the metal there is too thin and would just get torn up easily. I do wish the larger catch safety was a bit longer, but it does its job and it works out very well.
customer_reviews.author: mrplow732

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: The pictures truly are the same as the product, however it comes in such a poor packaging that you'll spend more time actually trying to bend the metal parts that got ruined due to the poor attempt to secure the corners. After a couple of days of mindless hammering to get it to fix i was able to put it together. Hopefully this will not crash down on me and place me on the list of death by natural selection.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Poor design for sure.
customer_reviews.text: This product is a little unstable even though I have it installed on a commercial carpet. The "weight plate" holders are too large in diameter to hold the 2" variety of weight plates so plan on having somewhere else to hold your plates. Overall, the product is workable but I should have spent the extra $$ for a more robust unit. Pull ups can get the rack swinging, but it doesn't seem like it would fall over under normal use. I had mixed feelings about the 2 or 3 star rating. But suffice it to say I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Dan P.

customer_reviews.title: months later and no complaints
customer_reviews.text: With one person reading instructions and two people assembling, it took less than half an hour easily. Directions very easy to follow. Everything was included. The box was a little damaged - not a surprise since it was so large and heavy - but everything was still inside and fine. Set up it is very sturdy. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah S.

customer_reviews.title: Great rack!
customer_reviews.text: They sent me the wrong color (gray instead of white) and there was some damage/dents. Not to bad. It feels heavy duty and sturdy. Make the investment now. Health is wealth.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M

customer_reviews.title: Functional but prob not as nice as other racks
customer_reviews.text: The box was pretty rough once it arrived. It had multiple holes in different areas. Upon opening and examining the rack, it looked quite beat up. Once it was put together, my wife asked me if I bought it used. However, I didn’t buy the rack for it to look pretty, just wanted it to be functional. So far it is. No issues outside of shaking a bit during pull ups & toes 2 bar exercises. I’d recommend buying nicer j-cups...for the price, I’m pretty happy.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Postell

customer_reviews.title: product does not cater to all CAP products
customer_reviews.text: I have CAP weight plates and bars for the 1" plates, but they do not have the option (or option to buy) accessories for the 1" plates. Therefore, I cannot rack them when not in use, so the plates and bar sit on the ground. You would think if CAP manufactures 1" plates, they would accommodate them.
customer_reviews.author: dave.h.

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I received my Rack today in the mail, we assembled it and it was easy to put together but we quickly realized it was missing three main parts! The packaging was missing the storage racks and one of the bar holders. So pretty much incomplete. I’ll be contacting the manufacturer tomorrow just a little upset that they would be missing parts on a brand new order.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Just ok squat rack
customer_reviews.text: Thinner steel than what I expected and kinda wobbles side to side but it holds up for my needs. The packing was horrible. Box was barely holding together and almost every piece came scratched or dented. A decent buy at the $200 range but I noticed some sellers are ripping people off at the $300 and $400 range. Not worth over $300. If i didn’t have such a tough time finding workout equipment during COVID I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick P.

customer_reviews.title: Overall good purchase for the money
customer_reviews.text: Overall seems like a good rack for the money. Really easy to assemble. Probably not the best for really heavy lifts but overall great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: j.Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect... almost
customer_reviews.text: I love my power rack! What I'm a bit disappointed about is that the metal catches of the J-hooks and safety pins do not fit flush with the rack; there's not enough length on the plate holders (I can only fit 2 large bumper plates on each peg); and, if I can be picky, the packaging wreaked of someone's stale cigarette left in the box, and the stench is still on the metal pieces of the rack. In spite of all this, this power rack is just what I needed, and I would buy it all over again if I had to make the decision.
customer_reviews.author: CFC #1

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Really unsafe, I took photos documenting everything out of the box. The product looks heavily used and what seems to be just thrown in a new box. Parts are inconsistent which jeopardizes the user. I’m honestly amazed a company would put such a poorly designed inconsistent product on the market.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Not a good cage
customer_reviews.text: Mine had no hardware and received damaged with only parts of the box left. The box completely disintegrated. Very flimsy and customer service are a nightmare to deal with. After getting parts after a month and a half we tried it and this thing is not sturdy. The parts do not fit together well.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Good for bench press sucks for squats and pull ups
customer_reviews.text: Its ok. A little awkward. But does the trick. Wish i could return it and get a better one. Not good for squats unless you can anchor it down. Moves alot when trying to rerack your weights during squats. Scared its going to fall.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for, and great for the price. Wish the j hooks were a couple inches longer. put it together myself without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Abby L

customer_reviews.title: missing parts, not as sturdy as looks.
customer_reviews.text: got the order opened the box missing some of the hardware, had put a ticket in and never got a response. got replacement parts from a home depot, installed and the rack is not as sturdy as it looks, i would not recommend buying if youre unsure of this buy, there are better sets out there than this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy weight no wobble
customer_reviews.text: After a 20 min assembly I was interested to see if it would wobble while doing pull-ups. I weight 195 and it was very stable without any wobbling. The construction of it is beffy and attachments well made. I look forward in utilizing it to its fullest.
customer_reviews.author: Armond Andranian

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: The Product is average and works for a home gym. the packaging was absolutely horrible, and missing parts.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: It'll do
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done, they could have done a better job with the rubber on the bar racks, nothing that a dab of gorilla glue won't fix. They also could have configured the safety rack to pivot in on both sides. As it's constructed, one side pivots in and the other pivots out, directly into the weights hanging on the side of the cage. Obviously not designed by anyone who lifts with frequency
customer_reviews.author: Rikabod

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Power Rack!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my son, who works out daily. Arrived on time & my son really likes it. Just what he needed to complete his gym area! Thanks, Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, really versatile
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after the gyms closed, at that time I was spending most of my time in something like this. I added a bench to this and if I could have gotten dumbbells I would have been all set. I wish there was more weight storage on it, but that's really the only complaint
customer_reviews.author: James Smiley

customer_reviews.title: Good basic rack
customer_reviews.text: Very good for a pull up station or light squats. The J hooks and spotter arms seem cheap. Spotter arms are short and the J hooks have an oversized lip on the front. There is a little side to side movement on the rack, even when secured to a lifting platform. Overall it is a good basic rack, but not for extreme heavy lifts or loads.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with broken welds and unusable. Far too heavy to ship back. Will attempt to have it rewelded.
customer_reviews.author: manifest destiny

customer_reviews.title: Missing items from box.
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had the chance to use it yet but it seems ok for now. The only complaint is that one of the sides to store the weight plates was missing. I emailed them but no response yet which is why I rate this item with a 3.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, GREAT for the price
customer_reviews.text: Box was a little beat up, but not destroyed like previous reviews. Some pieces have minor blemishes straight out of the box. Went together easily. I used my own tools not the ones provided. I have only used it for body weight exercises so far, pull ups, leg raises and it is slightly shaky from left to right at the top. For the price, I think it is great. Looking forward to using this with rings, and Olympic plates.
customer_reviews.author: Cathie

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Well made piece of equipment suitable for chin-ups, pull-ups, overhead presses and squats.
customer_reviews.author: annabelle

customer_reviews.title: Metal was bent and rust was painted over; very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived damaged: there was rust that was painted over and the metal was bent and I was very unhappy and disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: clearwaterkid

customer_reviews.title: Get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.text: Poor packaging. Comes pretty much with scratches from the shipping process. Not as sturdy as I hoped. The vertical weight storage is too big(2 plus inches). Does not fit Olympic plates. Included washers are useless(too thin). J-cups and spotter arms won’t fit in one of the hole positions. Spend a little more money and get better quality rack.
customer_reviews.author: James C Lin

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, good for squats and bench.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Solid constructions. Weight rack pins seem to hold 45 plates alright so far.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but....
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the power rack is excellent! The only problem is that when it arrived the box was a little trashed and the main stands, supports that hold up the pull up bar, had intricate engravings that were formed during the transportation (Hopefully from the transportation). As an Asian, I don’t mind the semi-deep scratches since it doesn’t affect the overall usage of the equipment. Also the barbell rack attachment came bent a bit. To save time, I bent it back myself instead of complaining and hoping for a refund. My final statement, great power rack just don’t be surprised if there’s scratches when it arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Thai

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Box came in damaged and opened. The side racks that hold plates were missing ....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with this rack. I often have 225+ On it with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: As far as size it isn't that big and fit in a spare bedroom easily.
customer_reviews.text: The rack is exactly what you would expect. the quality is average I would say but it supports the weight as it should, it could use an additional brace on the vertical bars where the sleeves fit on but aside from that three weeks with the product and haven't had any issues. As far as size it isn't that big and fit in a spare bedroom easily.
customer_reviews.author: r.j. Skalet

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: Had yo use an electric drill with a 5/8ths (I believe) socket and the tools that come with it so not work. It's very sturdy and works well. Not worth the price though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value; thick, solid, tight.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the small footprint I have available, and by the time I need a rack that is rated for more than 500#, I can hand this off to someone starting out. Have failed 365 a couple of times and the safeties are solid. I would suggest adding lock washers or blew thread locker to the split upright bolts, as I've had them back out a little a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Ard

customer_reviews.title: when the package arrived the cardboard was torn and falling ...
customer_reviews.text: when the package arrived the cardboard was torn and falling apart. There is rust on the metal parts. All of the hardware required to assemble the rack was missing. One of the upper bar catches was missing as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ross

customer_reviews.title: People at CAP Barbell need to do a better job packing the parts!
customer_reviews.text: All the parts were there but several were scratched up before they even came out of the box! The assembly instructions were written by someone who likely worked at IKEA. They were not the easiest to follow. I found a You Tube video that helped with installation. However the price was decent and it didn't take too long to receive.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary

customer_reviews.title: If you can afford a more sturdy rack then invest in it.
customer_reviews.text: Good looking rack (that’s what she said), yes it looks good but you can tell that it’s cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rack, the hooks could use more modification in ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rack, the hooks could use more modification in the sense of being more sturdy but overall the rack does its job. The plate storage on the sides are extremely reliable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: There's 3 parts missing and a bag of nuts and bolts thats have nothing to do with assembling.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack, Awful UPS Handling...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The rack was easy to assemble and it is nice and sturdy for a half rack. The pull-up bar rests at a perfect height for standard 8' ceilings and allows my lengthy 6'4 frame to do pull-ups w/o bashing my head through the ceiling. The square tubing is 3"x3" and has a 1" diameter hole in case you were wondering. CONS: I wish Cap made some more accessories that you could mount to this rack like a dip bar. The worst part of this item was the shipping. UPS (United Package Smashers) really did a "bang up job" (pun intended) handling this one.
customer_reviews.author: Justin W

customer_reviews.title: Steer Clear of this product Its A Total Junk
customer_reviews.text: shipped missing multible parts including the bolts. Shipped in makeshift box full of dirt and dust that went everywhere when opened. I strongly recommend to steer clear of this poorly conceived joke of a rack!
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT B VAHEY

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical from the reviews but I am 100% satisfied with this squat rack!!
customer_reviews.author: Liz D.

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre product beat up due to bad packing
customer_reviews.text: Box was ripped open at one end. Parts were completely bent or scratched. Locked everything down with a socket wrench and the top part still sways. Spotter arms are too short to be useful for squats.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t get nuts and bolts
customer_reviews.text: I waited a whole month for this product only to find it missing the nuts and bolts. I gave it a one star because I can’t even assemble it after waiting so long. Please CAP, send me the nuts and bolts so I can assemble it. It would cost me more than $100 to buy each piece individually from home depot
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: The only issue I have found is if you store ...
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I have found is if you store extra plates on the side of the rack . The plates on the bar will hit them unless you have a bar longer then 86 inches
customer_reviews.author: Joshua a Fairfax

customer_reviews.title: Like most people said
customer_reviews.text: Like most people said, the box it came in was beaten up pretty bad. I had missing nuts and bolts, and the frames were a little damaged. So had to go to Home Depot and buy the missing nuts and bolts. When I finally put it together it look awesome. So far it holds up well. If you want a alright squat rack get this one. Keep in mind you are most likely going to have parts missing.
customer_reviews.author: JrAdeky

customer_reviews.title: Great to build strength
customer_reviews.text: Great to build strength. All you need in a home gym is this plus an adjustable weight bench, weight plates, an Olympic bar, a dip bar, a dip belt and a set of adjustable dumbbells. and a punching bag.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon P.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality and poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived somewhat smashed, all parts are scratched and damaged, and all hardware is missing or spread somewhere all over the box
customer_reviews.author: tomer

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Pull-up bar not that stable if you move to the side a little it moves. Rack came with a lot of dents and scratches and is not packed that good.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Lam

customer_reviews.title: The Power rack looks like it was a previously returned item
customer_reviews.text: The Power rack looks like it was a previously returned item. The packaging for the bolts was open, several parts were bent and the packaging was open on all the pieces. Not happy with the quality
customer_reviews.author: Jason

product_meta.title: CAP Barbell FM-8000F Deluxe Power Rack
feature_bullets: Heavy-Duty Construction – Steel Construction Comprised of 12- and 14-Gauge Steel Thickness; Overhead Workout Station Is Made With High Grade Tubular Steel
Durable & Reliable – 3-Step Powder Coat Finish for Exceptional Durability; Gussets for Extra Reinforced Support; Capped Frame Ends to Prevent Oxidation

FEATURES – TWO plate posts, THREE band posts on each side to add resistance, TWO j-cup bar catches, TWO safety catches, pull-up bar & bar holders with ABS sleeves to prevent scratches when removing/storing an Olympic bar; 30-day manufacturer’s warranty
VERSATILE – Use this power rack to perform squats, bench presses, pull-ups and more; Target the upper and lower body; Incorporate an adjustable bench for added versatility (bench sold separately)

SPECS – Assembled specs 47-inches deep x 61-inches wide x 85-inches tall; Power rack weighs 103-pounds; Maximum weight capacity of 600 lb, 300 lb on bar catches & 300 lb user capacity for pull up bar; Bands, weights & other accessories not included

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
